Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, excellent location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: FJWhittle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location within walking distance of the Royal Palace, Plaza Mayor, Gran Via etc You have a choice of three metro stations nearby and the trains are new, the underground is also clean and cheap. Our room was large with all modern facilities including a safe and had kept historical features including a balcony. The breakfast room is beautiful and the range of food hot and cold is amazing. The bar is very reasonable and a bottle of wine from room service is only 10 euros. The staff are very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: Nuzzzzie
Reviews.Content: This was a really great hotel and I was pleasantly surprised! I booked this hotel in a 30% off sale as we ended up saving a lot of money. The reviews were quite worrying and I was quite nervous about staying at the hotel. When we arrived, the receptionist was very friendly and checked us in very quickly. He told us that we had been upgraded to a bigger room as we were staying for a long time (10 days). So that was a nice surprise! The room was very large and spacious with plenty of room to walk around. The bathroom was also a good size, with a bath/shower, toilet and bidet. The room was clean and the cleaner came in daily when we were out to make the bed and change the towels. The air conditioning worked great and was actually a bit too cold! But we didn't mind, we just would turn off for a little while and let the room warm up. Unfortunately, we didn't eat at the hotel at any time because our room didn't include breakfast. The staff were pleasant and the receptionist organised our transfer to the airport within minutes and it was only 35 euros. I saw that some people said the hotel was 'old and needed updating', whereas I totally disagree! The lobby was newly decorated with marble flooring and the sitting area had old fashioned style seats and sofas in purple and green - I felt like I was in Mad Men or some other TV show based in the 50s/60s. The lifts were a bit old and creaky but it just added character to the hotel. Really great experience and I would definitely recommend. Also, the hotel was around a 10 minute walk from Puerta del Sol, a 4 minute walk from Gran Via, a 2 minute walk from the Royal Palace. The tapas bar across the street called delGreco was nice for a drink and the chicken wings were fab! There was also a place on the way to Gran Via, about a couple of minutes away, called Nemrut which did the best kebabs ever!

Reviews.Title: “Great Break in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Maywex
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in the Tryp Ambassador. Hotel spotless through out and the attention to detail was second to none, flowers in reception just one example. Hotel is close to centre but away form the busy streets so it has the best of both. Breakfast in the hotel was beautiful. Staff very helpful and obliging. Rooms were well laid out and spacious. Madrid is a beautiful place to visit and this hotel made our stay excellent. 5 nights away felt like 10. Dining & Beers, great value to be had. Don't be afraid to wander off the main streets a little. great food and beer and better prices. PS check out the Mercado de San Miguel.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Tryp Ambassador!”
Reviews.Author: beacha
Reviews.Content: I am sitting at the Tapas bar across the street from the Tryp Ambassador and wanted to share my wonderful experience here. I came to Madrid alone and could not be more pleased with the hotel. I was greeted warmly, the reception staff are excellent, and the hotel is on a great location- a short lively walk to most everywhere. The hotel rooms are large, beautiful with Marble and a Brazilian looking cherrywood hardwood floor. Bathrooms are large, marble with a large tub and bidet. Breakfast is very nice and included on many rates. Hotel is a very short walk to metro. Staff are great. I could not be happier with the Tryp Ambassador. Great rates too! You will love beautiful Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Nice upgrade”
Reviews.Author: John W
Reviews.Content: Located in the Opera area very convenient for all the best parts of old town Madrid, this hotel is a great base for a short stay. The staff are all very friendly, relaxed and helpful: when we arrived I asked for a room with a view, the gave us keys for two of their junior suites, (upgrade cost 34 euros per night) we chose 638 which is more like an apartment, with a circular staircase up to a lounge that overlooks a good part of the city. The suite has free WiFi, TV, small fridge, a safe, a trouser press and a huge bed that was very comfortable. One small negative was the noisy air-conditioning but it didn't prevent a good nights sleep. Once checked in the concierge helped us plan our weekend and gave us a map to navigate the city, all his advise was spot on. The lounge and bar areas are stylish and comfortable and although we didn't eat in the restaurant the breakfast (included) was one of the best I have had.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Staro311
Reviews.Content: Good location, easy walk to town, lots of outdoor restraurants all around. We like the one right across the street. ate there several times- reasonable prices. Room was not cool- seems like when we left and took out our key the a/c & ref shut off. No ice or vending machines as we Americans are used to, but we are in their country- so no real compliants. The garage out the front door to the right has a soda machine-less than a Euro. No washrags in rooms. Very loud at night, parties all night and screams. We opened the windows, but no screens, or balconey. Good people watching window.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed 3 nights with 38-person tour group”
Reviews.Author: gpreston24
Reviews.Content: Hotel was about average for hotels I have stayed in while traveling with Grand Circle Travel. Breakfast was good, free wi-fi was nice but slow. Room was small and bathroom was very small, but perhaps some European hotel rooms are even smaller. There was a safe and mini-bar, in which one or two small personal items could be refrigerated. The room (#439) overlooked the street in front of the hotel, and on Friday and Saturday nights there was a great deal of street noise, Madrid being the late-night city that it is. However, the bed was comfortable and with 6 hours of jet lag I was able to sleep despite the noise. The room contained an upholstered easy chair that was somewhat worn and uncomfortable. No sign yet of changes in the hotel from the new Wyndham management. I would recommend this hotel if you need this central location and are able to get a satisfactory rate.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!!”
Reviews.Author: Laurhol
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Tryp Ambassador and although I had read bad reviews (unrealistic) before I booked I just went for it. When we got there we were first delighted with the location! It is so close to the main part of town and right next to the metro which bring you out to the other attractions outside of town. The staff were so helpful and nice. The room was fantastic! Honestly didn't expect it to be so nice after the reviews but we were pleasantly surprised! Don't be put off by bad reviews! I will definitely be back to Madrid and will be staying in the Tryp Ambassador!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: SDAG
Reviews.Content: The rooms on the upper floors away from the street are the quietest. WiFi is free; must ask for code. Room was satisfactory; not fancy. Hotel was comparable to a Holiday Inn. Two subway stops are 5 minutes away. Can walk to the Prado (30 min.). Plaza Major, Mercado San Miguel and Botin Restaurant (famous for suckling pig) are a 15 min. walk away. The Royal Palace can be reached in a 5 minute walk. Le Corte-Ingles, Spain's largest department store, is a 5-10 minute walk. There is a supermercado (super market) located in the basement of the Le Corte-Ingles. Gran Via, a major street, is also 5-10 minutes away by foot. On the Gran Via are Broadway-like and movie theaters. Grease and the Lion King were being performed in Spanish. Topolinos, a reasonable all-you-can eat buffet is 5 minutes from the hotel as you walk toward the pedestrian walkway that leads to Le Corte-Ingles and Gran Via.

Reviews.Title: “Don't panic - it's actually fine!”
Reviews.Author: Intrepid75
Reviews.Content: I was booked in to this hotel by business partners, was a bit concerned, given the reviews. Yes, the entrance is rather plain (but there are very elegant fresh flowers in the entrance hall), but there's a nice lounge with skylight beyond the reception and a nice bar beyond that. It's a bit of a rabbit warren, with lifts in several locations and twisting corridors. The corridors are narrow and quite run down. But my room was a pleasant surprise. Reasonably spacious room and bathroom, very comfortable bed with good quality linens and lots of very comfortable pillows (not always the case in Spain!). What might have been a somewhat austere room was really brought up to date and made much cosy by a feature wall painted a brick red. A very clever decorating touch. Excellent buffet breakfast with very long hours (7am to 11am on weekdays, if i remember correctly). Free and very fast wifi in both the rooms and the lounge. Staff were pleasant and helpful. Really, apart from the grim corridors, i have no complaints at all. It's not a designer hotel, but a perfectly pleasant, comfortable, if somewhat oldfashioned hotel. It's good to have places like this! I'll happily stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in City Centre”
Reviews.Author: TJS191
Reviews.Content: Reading the comments here made me a bit dubious about whether to choose this hotel, but I am glad that I did. It's situated right between two Metro stops in a relatively quiet street, within easy walking distance to Sol, Opera etc. Madrid is really jumping and partying doesn't stop until 7.00am, so I wouldn't have fancied an hotel on a main street. On arriving, the receptionist gave us loads of information including a really good street map & metro map, & a leaflet re the Easter processions & activities. There is no clue about the free WIFI anywhere in the hotel, but because I'd read it here beforehand, I also got this arranged when we checked in. WIFI comes in blocks of 48 hours, you can renew it as much as you like. Our room was massive, the bed and pillows were really comfortable. Everything was very clean. The bathroom was typically Spanish and a lively shade of orange! It was a stark contrast to the contemporary room, but we holiday in remote parts of Spain so weren't fazed by it. The bar area is pleasant, with a resident parrot, and the barman who served us was very friendly and spoke excellent English. The breakfast selection was huge and seemed to cater for all. It runs from 7.00 - 11.00, ideal if you have been out until late the previous night. Yes the carpets are quite worn, but the place has character, it's not a square box divided up into further identical square boxes. I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “An overall comfy stay”
Reviews.Author: EmSea82
Reviews.Content: Summarizing the pros and cons into a few bullet points. Pros: - very central location, about 5 minutes walk from the metro and to the city centre - a generally comfortable room, old, but well maintained. Great bed and pillow (dare I say comparable to westin) - free 48 hours wifi (you need to ask from the reception. We only found that out on the last day) - big spacious room Cons: (just slight downside but negligible) - the old building means the door comes in a normal key and it's quite difficult to open. Could be our luck that we got a room with difficult door, we got stucked as we couldn't open the door 3 times and had to ask for help - you might want to check google map and chart out your route from the metro to the hotel before arrival as it gets a little confusing (but was easily resolved with friendly people around that gave us direction eventhough we couldn't speak Spanish) Overall great stay, decent, comfortable and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Delicious and various breakfast makes it up for other things”
Reviews.Author: pepca
Reviews.Content: Breakfast and the central location are the best advantages of this hotel. Breakfast is plentiful with big collections of cereals, fruits, yoghurts, different types of cheese, bread, cakes, pastry, fresh juices and whatnot. The Royal palace is just around the corner and so are 2 metro stations. All the main tourist attractions are within walking distance. Rooms are big and clean, bed was comfortable but furniture is obsolete. Air Con is extra loud (very old) but it worked all right. It bothered me that I was placed in a smoking room which stank a lot (didn’t know it’s aloud to smoke in the hotel); there are ashtrays on the hallways as well and I smoke entered my room occasionally. Maybe there is a non-smoking section somewhere. I didn’t find any information about the hotel in the room (breakfast time etc). Staff was OK but nothing extraordinary. Wi-fi works well and is free for the time of your stay; you need to obtain a 24-hours password at the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional”
Reviews.Author: Juhani T
Reviews.Content: This is not a design hotel etc. It is a traditional Spanish hotel. It always amaze me how practical and functional traditional spanish hotels can be. It is a pleasure to stay at this hotel. I have stayed here several times and will do so in the future aswell. The hotel has a very central location, close to Gran Via, Opera and the Royal Palace. The rooms are big. You have plenty of room for your luggage and yes, there are hangers for all your clothes.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for citytrip”
Reviews.Author: Slangenburgh
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel for a citytrip with friends of your partner. Very good location: only a 2 minute walk form the Gran Via, Puerta del Sol is 20 minutes, Opera 4 minutes and Plaza Mayor about 15 minutes. Friendly staff, good service. The rooms are nice and very clean. Bathrooms are a bit outdated but clean and very comfortable. The only real disadvantage is that there is in the weekends a little bit of noise from the people visiting the bars across the street.

Reviews.Title: “An odd hotel but in a good location”
Reviews.Author: traveljuno
Reviews.Content: Great location. Not a pretty hotel. The entrance looks like a drive way. Weirdly laid out hotel with a lobby in a room past reception. Almost hard to remember your way through the warren-like halls. I didn't love the service. Half the people were nice. A couple people were rude, like one of the men who served breakfast. I had to stay for work for 6 whole days and some of the staff were nice and remembered me, and the breakfast man was angry with me for coming in for breakfast 10-15 before they stopped serving breakfast, saying "Everyday, everyday" in Spanish (a great way to start the day. I'm in the entertainment industry and had to be up late for film screenings and was in before closing, not after. The rooms were huge, but very old school (with funny window treatments and not so great decor. A little spartan and not warm or well decorated. You could hear noise like others' TVs, and any staff outside, doors slamming. The lock on my room was pretty impossible to work. The internet was really spotty, which makes it hard to work. There was construction in one wing. I would stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Many good features!”
Reviews.Author: Poskers
Reviews.Content: The Tryp Ambassador does have a note of faded elegance, but we enjoyed it alot and had no problems. It is in a great location on a quiet side street leading right down to the Opera area. There is easy access to 3 different metro stations as you are touring the city. The staff is helpful even if they are busy. Housekeeping is great and the breakfast is just the best ever...if you stay you must try to book breakfast included. We had a lovely view of the inner courtyard. I hope that the new Wyndham owners will invest appropriately in this classic hotel and it's staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very central, but old and tired”
Reviews.Author: LukeOnTheRoad
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a walking distance from the very center of Madrid. And this is pretty much the only nice thing about this place, in need for a renovation. The experience at this hotel ranges from "maybe-3" to "almost-4" stars depending on what side of the hotel you get assigned to. If you find a great deal on the internet, then it's likely going to be the shabby side of the hotel: dirty carpets, rundown corridors, sad old rooms overlooking the inner walls of the building, tired furniture, two tiny beds pushed side by side instead of a proper queen size. Avoid in summer time: the old air conditioning system in the rooms is so noisy (I'm serious, it's unbearable in daylight, but inconceivable at night) that you can't actually use it. And it's not just one room: when you switch it off, you can hear the same noise coming from other rooms as well. If you plan for a romantic getaway in Madrid, this is probably not where you want to be, unless you make sure you book a super-superior room, or get lucky. According to other reviews that I read, someone did find some nice room in this hotel. Lucky you!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, good location but up for a renovation”
Reviews.Author: H08H
Reviews.Content: There is a difference between left and right of the reception. Go left and it is a bit more stylish and 4*, go right and corridors and rooms are more 3*. Allthough in general rooms are spacious. Free internet everywhere is a plus. Breakfast is good by spanish standards. Overall the hotel is in need of an overhaul and restyling. As staff is cordial and facilitating one tends to favour "final verdict" for a touristique endeavour of Madrid this is an ideal starting point.

Reviews.Title: “LOUD air conditioning units”
Reviews.Author: AnnTea
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, the front desk people said nothing as we walked to the only visible elevator, got our entire luggage into it only to find out that we had to walk down a hall to get to the elevator that would take guests to the floors where the rooms were located. A/c was not central, and would make a loud boom-like noise when it turned off; could not get asleep b/c of this, so staff put us in another room, and same thing. The rooms feel spacious, and appear to be very clean. The hard wood floors appeared to be cleaned well, and there was not any dust or dirt hiding in a corner anywhere that I could see.

Reviews.Title: “City Break”
Reviews.Author: Sian007
Reviews.Content: We booked this as part of a BA city break. The hotel was really well situated (right by the plaza by the opera house). The staff were very pleasant and very helpful. The hotel was good although a little run down but not dirty and the hotel bar prices are astronomical in comparison to the very pleasant little bar opposite. Breakfast was briliiant. Overall it did ticked all the boxes for what was needed for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Nice central hotel”
Reviews.Author: theycallmegail
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nicely decorated and is in a excellent location for buses,underground and is only 5-10 minutes walk from all the main shops and bars towards the Sol area. The only thing we could possibly gripe about is that we booked a romantic package which was meant to be a nice upgraded room with a bottle of cava waiting - We got a dark twin bed room with a view of an internal wall and no Cava! After complaining at reception we very grudgingly got a room change to a standard room with balcony which was really nice, although had no coffee or tea making facilities like the last room. The Cava we had to request 4 times before it arrived 6 hours after check in. We did like the hotel and the pool area upstairs was lovely too it was just a little tainted by our first few hours service at the hotel- as first impressions DO count.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Nicholsbex
Reviews.Content: Located less than a minute away from the opera house, the central location of this hotel meant that we were able to walk to all of the main sights. The staff were friendly and, without having to pay extra, upgraded us to a suite. The rooms were cleaned every day and everything worked as expected. The decor (especially the bathroom) was a little dated, but this only added to the charm.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as the reviews would suggest!”
Reviews.Author: Man_From_Geneva
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through LastMinute.com - it was a Top Secret hotel and we took the plunge. The big double room (room 534) cost us £59 per night and it was great value. Granted, the hotel room was starting to show it's age. The paintwork on the bottom of the bathroom door was coming away, and the arm of the armchair in the room was looking a bit ragged. However, the room was spotless and it was cleaned every day - even when we didn't leave the room until after 13:30pm. The hotel staff were nice and polite and were there for anything we asked for. On the first night we asked for extra pillows and 5 minutes later they were delivered to our room. The flat screen TV didn't have many English channels but that's fine, we weren't spending time in the room watching TV when there was so much to do in the surrounding area. This hotel has a FANTASTIC location. Walk down the street and you reach Opera and the Royal Palace, walk upwards and you'll hit Gran Via, another street will lead you to Puerto del Sol. The hotel is just 50 metres from the Santo Domingo metro station. There are lots of bars and restaurants nearby. The fact that this hotel is so well situated in the middle of town probably accounts for being able to hear what's going on in the streets late at night - remember people, Madrid really comes to life after dinner which starts at 10pm. For the price we paid, it would be hard to beat this hotel with such a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: OMPSA74
Reviews.Content: We spent the 3 worst nights of our trip in this over-rated, over-priced ready for demolition hotel. Rude and ignorant staff second to none. First night, the AC did not work at all. Second night, there was no power for at least 6 hours. We ended up waiting for the power to be restored at the small bar across the street. Had to bang the door at 3 am so they let us in when the power came back. Elevator worked half the time we were there. Too much noise from vehicular traffic and locals partying at nearby plaza. I am still waiting for a refund or at least a courteous apology call from management.

Reviews.Title: “Abandoned old hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chus_Gijon
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its location, excellent to visit the old part of Madrid. Being Madrid a very safe city, it's vicinity to the red district is not a major issue. Said this, what we found behind the facade of this beautiful building is a nearly abandoned old hotel. The air conditiong in the room sounds like a jet, which makes impossible warming the room and sleeping at the same time. The mattress was very uncomfortable; clearly it hadn’t been changed since the last renovation. Forget also any expectations of a nice duvet, because all you can get is an old furry blanket. The room was small, old and smelly (we got a smoking room, in spite we had requested a non smoking room 2 months in advance) The hotel charges €18+taxes for a poor breakfast, which is served only after 7:30 on weekends. The only 4 star element remaining in this hotel is the price

Reviews.Title: “Not a Four Star Hotel - Watch out for Priceline "name your own price"!!!”
Reviews.Author: mytimetravel
Reviews.Content: Recently I used Priceline to book an international hotel. I named my own price for a four star hotel in central Madrid. The Priceline hotel was the Tryp Ambassador in central Madrid. For over 15 years my wife and I have traveled extensively all over the world. We were very disappointed in the fact that in order to get the features and amenities of a four start hotel room the hotel wanted 30 Euros per night for this privilege. We were given a non-smoking standard room that did not have wifi (advertised for free) a clock, iron, or hot beverage setup. The room, elevator and corridors to the room were very tired and in need of refurbishment. In addition, this room was smaller then all of the rooms we experienced on a recent trip to Japan. The Tryp Ambassador hotel may have a four star rating, but it is far from a four star hotel. After “winning” this hotel I realized that my “name you own price” was not a bargain. Priceline's customer service refused to respond to my complaints. They stated that this was rated as four starts and they were not responsible for the room I was given

Reviews.Title: “Annoying at first, then a bit of allright.”
Reviews.Author: nicadonis
Reviews.Content: We had the worst possible check in; surly staff, unpleasant and untidy reception. I was appalled. In India, where i come from, service is absolutely superb so to have staff that said, 'No' to everything was just unnacceptable. My room was pleasant as rooms go--it overlooked the noisy but full of life square.It had no airconditioning as the satff had said, "NO!" and that was that. I had to sleep with the windows wide open and suffer very noisy partygoers sing, pee loudly and kick garbage cans at 5 am. And yet. The location was but superb. There were excellent restaurants at hand, fantastic nightlife, great shopping and superb musuems just minutes away. I ate only breakfast every morning and it was excellent. Gradually, I came to like this hotel with its odd, original staff, who once one indulged them, turned out to be quite charming. The opera was across the street so you saw loads of elegant people in black-tie step out every evening after cocktails and there were noisy wedding parties in the reception room which made it all the more homely. So, would i go back? I think I would-like an irritating aunt who gets on your nerves but then who you turn to regard with affection, the Ambassador is just that sort of aunt.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay in a good neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: lmlucas
Reviews.Content: My husband, sister, brother in law and I stayed in this hotel last week. We had a very nice stay and at arrival the receptionist offered us an upgrade for a discountamount of €20,-- per room a night so we took a peak at the available rooms and decided to accept the offer. No regrets for us, for we had a lovely stay in a spacious room with benefits of a salon, coffee and tea facilities and a spacious bed. So we were very happy with our rooms. Breakfast was good and various. The bar was a place where you can drink tea, coffee or some other drinks. The parrot was a happy bird and was a free animal over days. The hotel is situated nearby a metrostation and in the neighbourhood are all kinds of restaurants, for sightseeing you can go to the royal palace, just around the corner, some 4 minutes walk. Madrid is a good place to be and this hotel is a good place to sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Zoeluma
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to the Palace, Puerta del Sol, Mercado de San Miguel, Gran Via and is very confortable. Right behind the hotel you can eat the best "Bola " a type of stew very typical of Madrid and the name of the restaurant is La Bola! Have it at lunch time, it is very heavy for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Old fashioned but good location”
Reviews.Author: AMTLondon
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this as a surprise after looking at reviews on this site. We booked a package which included breakfast. The hotel is down a quiet side street but very close to main attracxtions and good areas for eating, shopping etc. Check in was quite slow as a large group were just ahead of us but the staff apologised and were very friendly and helpful. They pointed out the main atractions on the map. We chose to upgrade to a Junior Suite which was very big. There was a good sized bedroom, a corridor with 4 large closets and a huge separate fully furnished living room. The decor was quite dated, especially the salmon pink bathroom suite but it was clean and very comfortable. There was enough space to entertain asa there were two couches, two easy chairs, dining table and chairs and desk. We were able to get Wi Fi. The negatives were no tea / coffee making facilities ( offered in other rooms I think ); old style small TV sets; and a door lock which usually jammed and needed a lot of fiddling about with to get opened. However the staff were efficient and friendly. The decor and style were very like the parador we stayed in this summer as it was slightly faded but pleasant. There was a nice palm court style sitting area under a glass roof which was never busy. The bar was OK but service was quite slow - local drinks such as wine / beer were reasonable. The breakfast was excellent with a huge range of items on the buffet, including cava. My husband had stayed in Madrid on business and found previously that the traffice noise kept him awake - but our room here was facing a courtyard and was very quiet. We would definately recommend it for a quiet, central location. It is near 2 Metro stations but we used taxis for convenience ( about 40 Eu each way ).

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, large room. Hotel in need of updating.”
Reviews.Author: alsobidingmytime
Reviews.Content: After arriving in Madrid at 8am, we traveled via Metro into the city. The hotel is very close to a Metro stop and was easy to find. Check-in was efficient and we were told our room would be ready in about 30 minutes (at 10am). We decided not to wait but it was nice knowing we could get in prior to the posted check-in time. The size of the room was quite large with high ceilings. The size of the bathroom was adequate as well. The bed was comfortable and the room temperature could be adjusted to our liking. I did notice that the carpet on the stairs and in the hallways was a little worn and there were some cosmetic issues with the walls/ceilings in the room but overall I was satisfied with the hotel. We did not eat at the hotel so I cannot provide any feedback.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: sery1000
Reviews.Content: (+) Room(upgrading pays) , Breakfast quality , Accessibility , Staff service(English spoken) , Tranquility(by upgrading) , Free internet , Vacant elivators , Bath robes & plenty towels , Flat bathtub(no slippery danger) (-) TV(old, small, bad position) , No sleepers , No view

Reviews.Title: “If you have to cancel, BEWARE”
Reviews.Author: madamsky
Reviews.Content: Was supposed to stay at this hotel for 3 nights but had to cancel our whole trip due to an unforseen medical issue. Not only was I devastated that I couldn't go on my trip, but I was sad to hear that I could not get ANY money back from this hotel. I understand cancellation policies and would understand some sort of penalty but they did not care about my situation nor did they try to work with me to find a solution. Staff very unhelpful and not understanding of the situation. Beware before you book! Make sure you consult with a psychic to predict hospital visits before you give them your credit card.

Reviews.Title: “Well located near public transport, comfortable old fashioned rooms”
Reviews.Author: maggieferrua
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located, near metro stations and major city highlights, but quiet as well. The bathroom was clean and spacious. The room could have been better, upholstery is worn and doors have scratches. The room was not huge, but for european standards was big. There are nearby cafes and restaurants. There was access to internet for a reasonable price near the lobby. I'm a coffee drinker, so I missed coffee maker in the room. The staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: FerrisXL
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Tryp Ambassador recently and must say was surprised by the good price-quality relationship and the big rooms. Although rooms look a bit old-fashioned (nothing for people looking for hip design), they are really comfortable, big, spotless and with wifi connection. Service was fine and the location is perfect - in the very center of Madrid, major sights, bars and restaurants are all within walking distance. I will certainly consider choosing this hotel again when I am back to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Just great!”
Reviews.Author: juhahi
Reviews.Content: Great location! Nice atmosphere and excellent breakfast! I got a huge room, but could be renovated here and there..... internet access worked fine in the lobby and bar, but in the room not..:(

Reviews.Title: “Good Accommodations, Good Location, Interesting Building”
Reviews.Author: tearose
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed in this hotel, and we enjoyed it just as much as before, if not more. The hotel occupies the former residence (palace may be too grand a word) of the Dukes of Granada, and is located in "Royal Madrid," about a 5-minute walk from the very grand Royal Palace. It is also about a 5-minute walk, all uphill, to the Grand Via. It is within walking distance of the Plaza Mayor, the Plaza del Sol, and many of the historic sites of central Madrid. The nearest subway stops are either a 2-minute walk uphill or a 3-minute walk downhill. Even though we had a standard room (the smallest size they have), it was larger than our rooms at either of the other 4-star hotels we stayed at in Spain. It was a pleasant size, with hardwood floors and an all-marble bath with all amenities. The heating system was very efficient, and the room was so well insulated that the heat rarely needed to come back on during the night, even though the weather was uncommonly cold for early March. The other classes of rooms in the hotel are larger, and are in fact rather large in comparison to those of most other 4-star hotels in Spain. Breakfast in a rather grand affair in a large room with crystal chandeliers, with waiters in sharp uniforms. Although rather costly (sometimes less if chosen when you book your room), it was very extensive and very good. There are ample hot choices of meats and eggs, excellent fresh pastries, and a very large assortment of fresh fruits and juices, along with cheeses and other items. If you enjoy a large breakfast to start the day, you will be pleased with this one. While the room and the breakfast were just fine, what I really appreciated about this hotel were its public spaces. These consist of a fairly large "living room" in a converted courtyard with a glass roof, a separate pleasant-sized bar area, and a separate restaurant, also with a glass roof, where we enjoyed a good meal. (Warning: hotel prices.) The night we dined there, a large green parrot enjoyed the goings on and occasionally commented from a corner perch well above us. The hotel staff were pleasant and capable, and helped us sort out the one or two problems we encountered. They also recommended a restaurant, Cafe Central (1870), which had arguably the best jazz I've ever heard--and I'm not young. Madrid has a plethora of good hotels, but I felt this was a good value for what I paid--94 euros per night (US $129), including tax and the two grand breakfasts. Without breakfast, we would have paid only 70 euros ($96). Larger rooms cost more, but our "basic" room was just fine. If you prefer to be i the old, hisstoric heart of the city, rather than the (also very attractive) newer Madrid to the north and east, then this hotel is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a good place.”
Reviews.Author: Gabeeroo
Reviews.Content: I've been to Tryp Ambasssador with my wife for 2 nights and the experience was very pleasant. The location of the hotel is very good, close to King's Palace, Puerta del Sol and a lot of attractions. The staff was kind and offered us a lot of help. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing bedroom having notified of a special anniversary”
Reviews.Author: SanJuanRosie
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately the tone of our stay was set from the moment of arrival as we struggled up the steps with our luggage at 11 o'clock at night whilst the doorman stood bolted to the spot with his hands in his pockets! Grateful though we were to drop into a comfortable bed it wasn't until the following morning that we fully appraised our inadequate room. My husband had notified the hotel reception 3 months in advance of our visit saying ""I have just made a reservation, Booking Reference 0900883974, for 5 nights from 16th-21st December 2009 on your 'Super Sale Europe' offer. As this stay is to celebrate a special anniversary please could you arrange a very good twin bedded room for my wife and I. This will be our very first visit to Madrid and we are very much looking forward to our stay at your hotel and visiting your exciting city. Thank you very much for your help."" However, I think what we were allocated must have been the smallest twin room in the whole hotel. Yes, I realise we were only going to sleep and bathe in the room but besides its size it was also in need of refurbishment and was very certainly not up to the standard of the hotel's current 4-star rating. In room 345 we experienced tatty damaged wallpaper, a dirty and misaligned 4' x 3' ceiling vent, pinched walking point between the refrigerator and the end of the bed, an enormously heavy security type door without a closer which banged noisily when pulled to as did all the other room doors along the corridor. The hotel's really only saving grace was in fact it's position, central and very near a lot of the major sights, but then this we knew when we booked and it was in fact for this reason we chose it from the other Madrid "Sol Melia" hotels available, that plus its nice public rooms. The one really good thing, and from our viewpoint one of its best recommendations, was the room attendant who kept our very inferior room spotless. A standard room was booked but we feel a substandard was given.

Reviews.Title: “An elegant, unassuming hotel, in a central location, a good base for sightseeing on foot or public transport”
Reviews.Author: 2manyhats
Reviews.Content: The staff were efficient and helpful, providing directions (in English) to various attractions. We stayed in a Standard room which was spacious, clean and pleasantly decorated, though some of the upholstery was a little faded. It would have been even more comfortable had there been tea/coffee making facilities in the room. The dark orange bathroom suite added to the dated appearance of the hotel, though it's good to have the choice of a bath or shower. The ventilation system didn't clear the steam very effectively. Our visit took place during the low season and it seemed as if the whole of Madrid was undergoing a facelift with roadworks and repairs in many plazas and pavements. Some work started early on the last morning of our stay. That said, the side road location meant that, traffic noise was minimal. The most disturbing noises were from the heavy room doors accidentally slamming shut, or 'musak' coming from a speaker in the ceiling. It took us some time to find the control for switching it off. (On the wall by the bed!) Our board basis was room only, but there are a wealth of places to have breakfast, including San Gines - a 5 minute walk away- for hot chocolate and churros. A must for an evening meal would be Casa Patas; enjoy the flamenco show afterwards. Only a minute's walk away is Cafe de la Opera for dinner and talented singing waiters. The hotel is a 2 minute walk from Santo Domingo metro. It's a 2 line change from the airport and about an hour's travelling time. Purchase a 10 journey ticket, remember the airport supplement. Our group of 4 shared the ticket, just pass it back to each other at the ticket barrier. You can keep a note of how many journeys are left with the 'counter' displayed at the barrier. Must see and do: 'Guernica' at Reine Sofia; evening aperitifs at Mercado de San Miguel adjacent to Playa Major, then on to Casa Lucio in Cava Baja; Prado museum, concentrate on Bosch, Velasquez, El Greco, Goya and Caraggio; Museo Thyssen interesting 20th century pieces, Caixa Forum -a free exhibition venue and a veritacl garden nearby. The hotel is a superb starting point for walking around the city and enjoying its unique atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at Tryp Ambassador”
Reviews.Author: Simone039
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for three nights. We had an excellent time in Madrid thanks to our stay at the Tryp Ambassador Hotel. The room we had was large and at a very quiet corner of the hotel. The breakfast in the morning is delicious. Everything is nice and clean. The staff is friendly, correct and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Huge Rooms and Very Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: ozelite
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in July '09 for 4 nights on a business trip. The location is extremely good for tourists, being very close to the palace, the opera, the main shopping district, plaza mayor and other Madrid highlights. Rooms were absolutely huge, the biggest I've seen in Europe with great aircon .. very quiet room with absolutely no noise at all and the place is an old converted palace so has a certain amount of charm and grandeur about it. Staff extremely friendly and willing to help and buffet breakfast was good as well .. no complaints at all ...

Reviews.Title: “Great location and accomodations near the Opera, shopping and 10 minutes walking from the Plaza Mayor.”
Reviews.Author: GoUCLAbruins
Reviews.Content: This four star hotel is in a great location- quiet street but access to subway lines one block away. Huge room, great A/C and fine bathroom. We did not eat at the hotel for we thought the prices were a bit high. There is internet access but we were unaware we could purchase and use the time over the three day period versus using the time in one sitting. Front desk gave a great recommendation for a restaurant near us by the Opera. There are special deals ont hewewbsite and through the hotel chain Sol Melia.We got three days for the price of two days and booked it a week in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place to stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: marqoos_pl
Reviews.Content: The location of the Tryp Ambassador Hotel was perfect. Just few steps from the main attractions, underground station, small bars and restaurants and shops of Grand Via makes this location perfect for a weekend break. You don't have to waste your time, ju can simply enjoy Madrit. Comfortable, clean and air-conditioned roomes, lovely lobby and restaurant. Keep in mind, this is more boutique hotel, not 'modern art gallery'. I can hardly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Faded charm”
Reviews.Author: bagicatz
Reviews.Content: The hotel has lost some of it's elegance but still has a sort of faded charm. Firstly ALL the staff are friendly and helpful. The location is very good - both for culture and shopping. The rooms are not small and have all the usual facilities. The breakfast was good but more fresh and less tinned fruit would have made a difference. We didn't try the restaurant so can't comment. Only real problem was the noise on a couple of mornings - but have to be honest; we were trying to sleep late. We did have a good rate which made it excellent value but I would recommend this hotel anyway for it's staff, location and general feeling. Yes it could do with an upgrade but at the risk of loss of character

Reviews.Title: “more a hostal than 4-star”
Reviews.Author: PDH01
Reviews.Content: strange hotel. the main positives were size of rooms (i had an upgrade) and the staff was friendly. However, for €180 I would expect more sound-proofing - as is only recommended for quit people with a keen interest in neighbours TV choices - and heat in the rooms. IMHO, the amenities are no more than you find in a Madrid hostal for a third of the price. location-wise, it great if you are touristing in traditional Madrid, but so are many other hotels...incl i saw two designer hotels around the corner i would check out if ever in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful time at the Tryp.”
Reviews.Author: leven4all
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at this hotel. I had read some of the reivews before we left and was a little apprehensive. However, my husband and I stayed there for six nights in April and found the sataff to be courteous and very helpful. We paid 20 Euros a day extra for an upgraded room and the money spent was well worth it. The room was very spacious. We also enjoyed the buffet breakfast. and found the food to be of very good quality. I would definitely recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Don't beleive everything you read !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 2008TravelSwindon
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Long Weekend staying at the Tryp Ambassador, we weren't originally booked in at this hotel, but were placed into this after our previous hotel overbooked, so I was very apprehensive after reading the reviews on this website. But we were really pleased with this hotel, it’s a 2 min walk from the tube station. Don't take a taxi, the cost of 35 Euros is better spent towards a meal, the tube only cost us 2 euros each and was so very easy. The hotel is in the centre of Madrid, but off a side street so its very quiet, no traffic noise at all. . Its a 2 min downhill walk from the Opera and a 5 min walk to the palace, overall in the centre of everything, The hotel is very grand & yes it is old and yes the stair carpets are a little tread bare and perhaps it could do with a make over, but if you look around it’s not that bad and we were pleasantly surprised by size of the rooms. The rooms are clean & nicely decorated & they are cleaned every day. Ok so the bathroom suite is orange as in some so of photo’s, but again its clean. The air conditioning is a little noisy but not enough to keep you awake at night, but then show me any air conditioning units that aren’t.. The staffs are friendly & speak very good English and will be happy to recommend restaurants to you. Would we stay at this hotel again, most certainly yes!!! .

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff”
Reviews.Author: JCD73
Reviews.Content: I just checked in and immediately logged in to post this review because the check-in clerk, named Beatriz, was so rude. When I asked her why she had to enter all of our passport information into the computer, she said it was to combat terrorism. Then she started to lecture me in a very condescending way about how Spain has been dealing with terrorism for 30 years. Know your history, she said. Dealing with terrorism isn't something new as it is for Americans. I was tired and just wanted to get to my room...didn't need a lecture. And didn't think it was her place to give it to me.

Reviews.Title: “Money stolen from our room - beware!”
Reviews.Author: Ali-king
Reviews.Content: Ok, I'll get the good bits out of the way, there is a nice breakfast buffet and the hotel is pretty much right in the centre of Madrid. The reason I give the hotel a 1 star "terrible" rating is that on our last morning we got our stuff ready so we could check out after breakfast then went down to breakfast which took us around 20 minutes. On our return to our room we found that someone had been in the room (on the 5th floor) and stolen money from my girlfriends handbag. We immediatley reported this to the manager who didnt seem to take us particularly seriously and noone even came up to our room to see what had happened. We spoke at length with the manager down in reception but he seemed unwilling to accept that there was a security issue in his hotel and someone, either a member of staff or someone from outside, had been in our room and stolen stuff. The impression we got was that once he'd got rid of us there would be no further action to find out what had happened and that would be the end of it. Not a great start to our last day in Madrid and not what we expected from what is supposed to be a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's All About The Location!!”
Reviews.Author: KangarooNYC
Reviews.Content: I previously read a few of the reviews. Most of the comments are dead on. Here are some of my comments to add: CAB FARE to hotel (from MAD airport): For us, I think it was € 35 [because of the additional person (I think) and a tarrif]. I did not leave a tip. Also, when we left our hotel (going back to the airport) at 7 am on a weekday, it cost €24. Whatever. That driver really helped us with our bags, so I tipped € 1. He seemed really appreciative of it though! Generally, I was advised NO TIP NEEDED for taxi drivers. LOCATION: Wonderful! It’s 2 short blocks to the metro (Opera station, Green Line). It’s also a 5-10 minute walk (depending on how fast you walk) to the Palacio Real (the Royal Palace). It’s also a 10 minute walk to the Plaza Mayor (a “must-see” on anyone’s Top Ten list of things to do!). STAFF: Very helpful. All speak English. Fluently. No worries there! Particular mentions go to Miguel (works days), Manuel (works nights), and Todor (youngish, works nights). They gave terrific advice and recommendations! ELEVATOR: Very small. It reminded me of my pantry closet for my linens (at home). Really small. They have a “0” floor (usually ground level). We were on the 3 rd floor, but when we tried to walk down, we could never get to floor Zero. So we had to use the elevator every time. Oh well so much for conserving energy. ROOM: Um… small. It made me feel like I was renting a studio apt in NYC rather than being in a hotel. But it was fine for its purpose. Always clean, well kept, but also small on the closet/storage. I liked that the hotel safe had shelving and was VERY EASY to use. Their were signs in the elevator for upgrades to a Junior or Master suite, but unless you were more than two people, I don’t feel it was necessary (or worth it). TELEVISION: Unless you speak Spanish or German (didn’t get that one! Is there a significant German population??), you are going to hate the tv here. Only CNN and FoxNews. Bring a dvd player or laptop and upload (or bring) a few movies to watch. ADAPTER PLUGS: Prepare to bring your own. This hotel does not supply any! If you cannot find it at a local electronic store, you can order these online if you are not leaving for your trip for at least a week (to account for delivery time). I emailed them a week before my trip, so I already knew this about them. ROOM DOOR: (Silly, but we needed help!) Put your key in the lock, turn the key to the right (leave the key there!), THEN (and only then) turn the doorknob to the RIGHT. Voila! Door opens. Insert your “stick” end of the key into the slot… otherwise, no electricity for you! (Strangely, the tv still works, but no lights.) INTERNET: If you have a laptop, do not pay for internet service! There is free (FREE!) wireless service in the hotel “court”/foyer area, off the lobby. (The same room with the couches and the arched glass ceiling.) We tried many times, but we could not get an internet connection in our hotel room. If you didn’t bring a computer with you, the hotel’s internet service (we thought) is very expensive. You are better off going to any of the internet cafes throughout the city. Many of them serve food (or coffee, at the very least) so you can kind of kill two birds with one stone there. GYM/ATHLETIC FACILITY: There was none in the hotel. I didn’t bother to ask whether the hotel had any complimentary guest passes anywhere. No matter – we did plenty of walking to make up for that! BREAKFAST: Okay… our travel agent pushed the breakfast on us. Breakfast was (in a word) SPECTACULAR. In hindsight, I think I would have tried to use a discount website and book the hotel MYSELF without breakfast. Oh, the buffet breakfast was WONDERFUL (more in a minute), but we felt obligated to overeat since we paid for it you know. I think you could do fine going off the beaten path elsewhere, and getting a croissant or pastry with coffee. By the way, the Spainiards LOVE LOVE LOVE their desserts (postres) with ANY MEAL: STARTING WITH BREAKFAST!! Assortment of anything for everyone, incl those with allergies. They love their pastries (so I’m skipping this), but they also love their meats & sausage & eggs! “Salad” bar style spread of stuff: baked beans, 2 types of sausages, various platters of cut fruit, whole fruit (apples, oranges, etc), champagne (it’s actually cava), 2-3 types of fruit juices, 2 types of water (gas/regular), ice (there is a CHARGE if you want this in your hotel room!!), cereals (we didn’t have any, but it looked like 2-3 different types), coffee/tea, cucumbers, corn, chopped tomatoes, dry nuts, smoked salmon (sometimes), various cheeses, salami, chorizo, ham, and a few other things that (b/c my Spanish was so poor) I didn’t know what they were. Oh, it’s not that I couldn’t ask, but my dictionary was so bad that when they answered, I’d still have no clue what that was. METRO (subway system): Very easy to use. Very clean. Quite safe. If you are there for 3 days or more, highly recommend the 10-trip bonos (bonus) for € 6,90. The only downside is the 10-trip card is per person; two people cannot use the same card. Otherwise, each one-way ride is € 1,15. We each used ours 7 or 8 times (we didn’t even finish it) and the bonos still saved us money! Two restaurants within walking distance worth mentioning- SOBRE DE BOUTIN: (near Plaza Major) You will need a reservation. The hotel will do it for you, just ask at the front desk! Ernest Hemmingway mentioned this restaurant in his book. AND, more importantly, it is the oldest restaurant in the world. No kidding! Yes, of course it's tourist-y, but you pay for charm, atmosphere and amazing, falls of the bone, yet crispy-skin roast meats. Their specialty is the roast suckling pig and roast lamb. We got one of each, but in hindsight, we'd get 2 orders of the cochinillo. TRES ENCINAS: OMG… excellent seafood paella! Not cheap but well worth what you pay for! We split the seafood croquettes (8 pieces), and the paella for two, each enjoyed a glass of house wine and the bill was around € 80 (yes, I tipped about € 2 – see my section about Tipping below). GENERAL TIP on RESTAURANTS: bread & butter is additional in Europe. I know, I know, but that’s what it is. If you don’t want the additional charge, you MUST SAY SO when you order (“no pan” or “sin pan” will suffice), or REFUSE IT if they bring it to your table before you even order. Also, they push the bottled water but we read that the drinking water in Madrid is perfectly fine. If you want tap water (I come from NYC, so I enjoy good tap water!), ask for “agua de grifo”. They will look at you funny, but you will get cold water, usually in a pretty glass pitcher, and usually with ice! SPECIFIC DAYS to know about: SUNDAYS: Bullfighting. Generally, it’s all year around except for the 2-3 cold winter months (December – Feb?). I think it’s either at 5 pm or 7 pm. Ask the front desk if you want to know. MONDAYS: Most (if not all) museums are closed on Monday. Many restaurants are closed on Monday as well. Call ahead (or ask the front desk to call for you) to be sure. WEDNESDAYS: Do not quote me (since we weren’t here on Wed) but I think the Changing of the Guard is done at the palace (Palacio Real) on this day. Again, ask the front desk. TIPPING: At self-service places (buffets, etc), zero tip. Easy enough! If you are unsure, carefully observe other people who leave. Do they leave money/change? Do they leave their tray/used plateware? You do the same! I generally left 1 or 2 euros. Examples? Two drinks at a hotel bar costing between € 9-12: 1 euro. A tapas lunch for 1 people costing around € 20-25: 1 euro. If more (like a € 55+ dinner): € 2. One dinner we did (by accident) was an outrageous dinner (excellent quality, make no mistake about my complaining!) costing € 98 for 2 people: 3 euros. People seemed appreciative enough, so I’m not sure if I tipped correctly, or if that was sarcasm on their part. Do not tip the taxi dude. If you tip him, do so if he helps you with your bags and maybe €,50 or € 1,00 tops! BEFORE YOU GO: Helpful to bring a small Spanish dictionary or any of the gamut of little books put out by any of the travel or language people. This is ESPECIALLY important if, like us, you enjoy going off the beaten path. Most people in the working world do not speak very much English other than “yes”, “no” or “Sorry”. I am not making any statements or putting any culture down; it is based on my own travel observation & experience. It was very humbling to conjure up my high school Spanish irregular verbs… but I think the majority of people seem appreciative if you genuinely try! If you have any allergies, I would specifically learn that word (for your allergic item) so you can ask the waiter whether that dish includes it (“este plato incluye ___?”). Better to know for sure than to spend your vacation at a Farmacia or worse (El hospital). Bring all medications you need for your trip in a ziplock bag. I prepared 8 days’ worth, each day in a snack sized bag, for convenience (since some of my vitamins look identical). Be sure to include pamprin/midol (GOOD LUCK explaining THAT to a pharmacist!), Citrucel (or fiber/stool pills), and even basic aspirin/motrin/advil or painkiller. Also, call up your credit card companies. Two reasons for this: first, you will find out what the fee is per transaction (yes, it was a surprise to me but using your charge card outside the US, the credit card companies tack on an additional fee to your purchase price!). VISA/MC is usually 1%, whereas AmEx is 2%. But you will want to confirm with them. Secondly, you want to tell them that you will be in Spain/Europe. The last thing you want to do is to be in a posh store and your credit card company thinks you aren’t you (fraud alert), and you have to provide the store additional identification [we almost never took our passports with us (we were mugged in Rome 3 years ago – learned our mistake then! Lovely US Embassy in Rome!!), except on travel days]. Spare yourself the hassle. REGRETS: We were here for (almost) 4 full days. If we had gotten better situated, I think I would have liked to have done the day trip to TOLEDO. Alas, we did not! BEST ADVICE I LEARNED BY ACCIDENT: Chat up your airlines steward(ess) during your flight. While I was waiting to use the bathroom, I decided to ask them a few questions. They have all been to Madrid (many times) and can give you advice and helpful tips (length of you hotel ride, metro, etc). They told me the advice I gave you (above) about tipping! Also, if your hotel is part of a chain like this hotel (sol melia), you can email them in advance of any questions/concerns you may have. They will respond well within 24 hours! You should DEFINITELY sign up for their frequent flyer-type program. They’re usually free and the perks are great! I would stay here again. The location was great. But this time, I would forgo the travel agent and try to get a hotel rate online. Hope my review was useful to you!!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was the best!!”
Reviews.Author: Hannah128
Reviews.Content: We were a bit appresensive about this hotel, because of some of the negative reviews. What a great suprise!! We liked this hotel above all others that we stayed in, while we were in Spain. We upgraded our reservation to a "junior suite" which was a VERY good decision. The suite was spetacular. The balcony was big enough for ten people. The suite was spacious, clean, and attractive. The technology in this hotel supercedes that of any I've stayed in, in the US. The staff were extremely helpful and responsive to any of our needs. This hotel was instrumental in our beleving that Madrid is wonderful! The hotel is located near almost everything we wanted to see, (We only used a cab once to go to Botin restaurant, which the hotel was able to secure a reservation for ) Reservations for this restaurant are often difficult to obtain with short notice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, nice room”
Reviews.Author: CharlieinTexas
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Tryp Ambassador for 2 nights (not consecutive) in August. Excellent location, 100 yards from Santa Domingo Metro stop (on no. 2 line) and 300 yards from Opera Metro stop (also on no. 2 line). Can walk to Opera, Palace, Orient Park, Sol Plaza, Gran Via, and many other places. Nice, fairly simple lobby, with nice (small) bar, and charming restaurant in atrium setting. Desk staff helpful, Internet connection in lobby (3 euros for 1 hour). Room had (fake (?)) hardwood floor, cable tv, nicely appointed, and bathroom was modern with all amenities. Here's the best part. Paid $70.00 (approx.) for each of the two nights, once on Priceline,com and once on Hotwire. Incredible deal for $70.00.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, impersonal and great location”
Reviews.Author: kaldal
Reviews.Content: Booked this four night stay through Hotwire, and paid only 75 USD a night. We had originally booked a hostel for the same price, but decided to give the four star, unknown offer from Hotwire a chance. Glad we did! The hotel is clean, the room was very spacious and the location is excellent. ¨Next to¨ the royal palace, royal theatre, and just a short walk from the charming old town of Latina. Bath was nice too, with big tub, bide and even a large window (one of three or four in the entire room, facing a tight courtroom). Main drawback was a very noisy aircon. It was very efficient, though... Breakfast was not included, but we paid for it on one morning. It was definitly four star, but should maybe have been included in the price.

Reviews.Title: “okay”
Reviews.Author: boss099
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Big rooms, nice interior, great loacation. A lot of noise from corridor. Very noisy air conditioning in the room. Bathroom need renovation

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel. It should be a 2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Denbo1
Reviews.Content: There is no bellman to help with luggage. The staff stands around and watches as you struggle with your bags. No room service, no pool. No parking garage.....you have to pay and go about a couple blocks away. The walls are paper thin and you can hear what your neighbor is watching on TV. When the A/C unit goes on it feels like a helicopter is landing on your bed. We have never been so tired after sleeping in a hotel room. The guy at the front desk says he is the concierge, but could not recommend a good local restaurant.....Pathetic. The internet in the room does not work.....ask the staff and they say....It's not my problem. It is in a great location, so if you don't plan on sleeping this is a good bet for you. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Billie_7
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in this hotel. Large room, great air conditioner, nice bathroom. With the exception of one clerk at the reception desk, all hotel employees were very helpful. Our rate included the breakfast buffet, which offered lots of choices. Food was very good. The assistant hotel director Xacobe Bartolome was outstanding. He went to great lengths to help me recover my purse, which I left in the taxi when we arrived at the hotel after an all-night flight. And the hotel manager sent a beautiful basket of fruit to our room the next day, expressing his regrets that our visit got off to a rough start. Of course, the rough start was the result of my own forgetfulness, so it was an especially nice gesture!

Reviews.Title: “Not nearly as bad as these reviews suggested”
Reviews.Author: One-and-Only-Aly-G
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 2-night stay at this hotel booked through work as it was a work trip. Having read these reviews I was not looking forward to the stay but I was very pleasantly surprised. The room was a good size although the bed and the pillow were pretty uncomfortable. The breakfast was good and a good variety. The hotel is situated in a former palace so does have an older feel to it. If you're used to staying in modern hotels then this will probably not appeal. One definite downside was that there were no leisure facilities but the location of the hotel was fantastic - no more than a 5-minute walk to the Plaza del Oriente and some lovely bars and restaurants. On the whole the staff were friendly - although there was a rather surly woman on duty whilst I was there but the others were friendly and happy that I was at least trying to speak a little Spanish. The hotel is a little dated and probably could do with a bit of an upgrade but on the whole it was not nearly as bad as these reviews suggested and this is the first time that I feel I've been misinformed by TripAdvisor reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, aging, old-style hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jet-Setter-SF
Reviews.Content: As a recent reviewer noted, this hotel is not a young stylish hotel, it is more likely described as the antithesis of the W. Even with the quirks I will describe below, overall it was generally positive experience. Planning to stay 6 nights, I opted to reserve a superior room, thinking it would give me more space and a nice view. While the first room they gave me was spacious, it was layed out in a bizarre irregular shape and had only one window facing a small light well. The second room was also spacious, but also layed out oddly, with a tiny room for the large bed and a large living space. It had a balcony, but that would be little use in the cold dreary month of January. I'm not usually picky about rooms for a short stay, but I asked for a room facing the street and got a slightly smaller but brighter room facing the street. This last room had the unfortunately typical two small beds pressed up against each other, but faced the street and had better light. (Note: when you reserve, call the hotel and ask for exactly the type of room you want and see if they will reserve the specific room number for you.) The room itself was in good shape and had clearly had a recent upgrade. (The major renovation was done in the early 90's judging by the installation date posted in the elevators.) The floors in all the rooms I saw had grandma-type furniture and dark hardwood floors. The desk was not set up for a business person -- no outlets nearby for a laptop or cell phone charger. Additionally, while the hotel advertises WiFi in all rooms, my WiFi connection worked only when sitting in one corner of my room, facing the corner. If WiFI is important, as for a room near one of the WiFi base stations. The minibar looked out of place, but was relatively well-stocked with typically priced items. (There's a little store just up the street for cheap water, snacks, booze, etc. -- ask at the front desk.) Room service was quick and friendly. Unfortunately, most of the hot dishes were usually luke warm on delivery. Food in the restaurant was generally very good. Great breakfast buffet. The staff all around was helpful and friendly, but mastery of English language varied from person to person. Other quirks: the doors to the rooms were like heavy doors to a bank vault. But there was no lock on the inside to keep housekeeping staff out. It was ironic to have a heavy steel door with heavy locks, that anyone from the outside could open. Definitely use the "do not disturb" signs. I described above that the hotel was recently renovated. Unfortunately the renovation skipped the bathroom. The bathrooms in all three rooms I saw were small and all had weird burnt-orange fixtures (including a bidet). The shower dribbled and wouldn't hold a position. The drop ceiling was stained and warped. But that was the worst part of the rooms. The neighborhood was under construction, and with all the above anomolies, I opted to move to a different hotel for my last few days, hoping to get a room with real internet access and a better locale. in summary, nice staff, quirky by decent accomodations, but not a good hotel for a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice central hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2003Ibiza
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights in this hotel during a business tryp with my husband. The hotel staff is very nice und helpful. The breakfast buffet was nice. The hotle is very central. The prices for the mini-bar are OK. The hotel is in an old palace its not a modern design hotel. I liked it.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible if you are young!!”
Reviews.Author: jopyme
Reviews.Content: Not really nice if you are young and have modern likes! This hotel is too classical, old renovated but still have furniture from the 40s. You feel like you are in the English Court but even worse, it smells old, it looks old, the only thing renovated is the floor but you have to take a look at the bathrooms which were the typical bathrooms that all our parents had when they were little. When you flash the W.C, and somebody is on the shower , your burn yourself with the hot water coming out!! Unbelivable for the XXI centruy....etc. We stayed in the best room Junior Suite, and not even this room has an exception!I don't recommend it especially if your are young and you are used to modern hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but definately not a 4-Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MddlevlleGrl
Reviews.Content: They were doing some major construction while we were there. Our room had been redone but we were unable to use the safe. They promised us every morning a new digital safe would be installed and it never showed in the 4 days we stayed there. There just didn't seem to be the decor or proffessional staff you would expect for a 4-star. But, I will say I would stay there again simply for the convience of location.

Reviews.Title: “A Bargain”
Reviews.Author: nwalesguy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights from August 10th in a twin room. I only paid $56 a night - what a bargain. The Hotel is well located - a short walk from the Gran Via, Royal Palace, Puerta Del Sol, Plaza Mayor, etc. I would say that the Hotel used to be very grand indeed - its now a little frayed at the edges. Huge room, wooden floor and nice shutters to keep the morning sun at bay. Very efficient and freindly front desk staff. Be prepared for the orange bathroom suite - not to everone's taste ;-). All in all if you get a great deal at this Hotel gor for it!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Trip Ambassador Madrid: good with some disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Wolfra
Reviews.Content: Hotel Trip Ambassador Madrid Date: May 2006 We just returned from a fly-drive in Spain. We stayed 4 nights in this very large hotel (4-stars) in the old center of Madrid and about 50 mtr from the metro. Everything within walking-distance. The street is (in relation to the location) rather quiet and not too much traffic. The breakfast was wonderfull: everything you wanted was here with a very good service. The rooms are large with good beds. The bathroom was a little bit worn out. It was only disappointing that the airconditioning in all the hotel-rooms was out of action. I asked for it, but the airconditioning started only from the 15th of May. At that time in Madrid it was already 30 degrees Celsius, so the room was very hot. In all the other 4 hotels we stayed during our trip, there was still a working airconditioning in the rooms. So before the 15th of May I cannot recommend the Trip Ambassador Hotel Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in central position”
Reviews.Author: nataliatiyad
Reviews.Content: A well located hotel in a quiet street in central Madrid nr the Opera. Stayed in December 05 and received room upgrade to junior suite. Cost approx £170 for 2 nights for 2 people. Nicely appointed rooms with good standard of decoration and good maid service. Good plentiful breakfasts in large dining room. Didn't take any evening meals as preferred to eat out in Madrids choice of many reasonably priced bars. Helpful reception staff who ironed out a problem when local taxi firm (Aerocity) fouled up on return journey to airport. Small but comfortable lounge used to take very generous nightcaps. Car parking is available in a small multi-storey directly opposite the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable two weeks”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two weeks, first in a large comfortable front room with couch,coffee table,desk,reading lights, side chairs, breakfast table and deafening street noise from demolition across the street. They switched us to peaceful, somewhat smaller, back room without couch & coffee table but magpies nesting in garden. A great service staff fixed minor problems quickly and room service breakfast in ten minutes. There's also an enormous buffet downstairs. Great location for Metro. A nice little English book store around the corner but greatest find was our nightly 6 pm restaurant just one block away from hotel, next to the Opera. It is called La Traviata. The food was lovely , best grilled salmon I ever ate - rare steak and LARGE green salads ! Meant we needn't wait for restaurants to open at 8:30.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zenmeyang
Reviews.Content: Very good location near Opera and Sol subway stations (3 min by foot). Very convenient to explore old Madrid and major tourists attractions. Located near Plaza Mayor, Palacio Real and Almaduna Cathedral (3 min by foot). Room was big and very well furnished. Good Service Nice breakfast for the price (7€/pp) Excellent value for money (72€ in august on the sol-melia site). A real 4* for me (especially in Spain...) Definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Not Super-luxury, but nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: DallasGlobeTrotter
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good, decently-priced hotel in the middle of all the action in Madrid. Decor in the rooms is a bit sparse, but the rooms are good-sized and clean. If you're looking for super-luxury, go somewhere else and spend a little (or a lot) more. If not, this is a great hotel for those looking for a comfortable place in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Not fabulous”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Everything was ok. Ok service, ok rooms (typical Europe, double occupancy 2 twins pushed together). food was below average. If the hotel is part of the experience for you, don't stay here. If you want an ok hotel with an ok price in a central location this would work. its in easy walking distance to a lot of attractions (palace, restaurants etc) and a 15 minute cab ride to the museums and main attractions. My overall impression: mediocre.

Reviews.Title: “Not for light sleepers”
Reviews.Author: preppride1798
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and centrally located, but the walls and floors reverberate every noice from adjacent rooms. So you basically hear the conversations, footsteps, running water and door slams of your neighbors. Keep in mind spaniards stay up late. Normally the noice would not really bother me, but I stayed there the night before flying back to the US. The noice keep me up until at least 2:00am on a sunday. Would not recommend if you need to have a good nights rest.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location but Simple”
Reviews.Author: mswoojie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very simple. I would not stay here if it is for a special occassion. The room was dark, the towels were ratty and the amenities were bare. However, the room and the hotel is very clean and it was central to Gran Via, Puerta de Sol and all other tourist locations. The hotel is on a side street so it is pretty quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a great price on hotel chain web site!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel this past August for 5 nights. We booked it on solmeia web site and got a great rate of 65 Euro a night! The room we got was HUGE and the staff were very helpful. The hotel can use some updating, but it has nice European decor and all the amenities you would want. There is internet access for a small fee and the breakfast buffet was very nice and delicious. We got a discounted rate for breakfast as well at 8.50 Euro each, otherwise its double the price. The hotel is walking distance to the Royal palace and plaza del sol. We recommend this hotel especially if you get a good rate on the hotel chain web site like we did.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for business not for romance”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Tryp Ambassador while a fine hotel is not really up to US four star standards so be forewarned. That was our first stop in Spain on a anniversary trip and we were somewhat disappointed in the hotel. The room rate was very good, and it's close to the Palace which is nice, but the street which it is on is a very blah street the hotel and rooms (we changed ours) are quite dark. Our room was very clean and spacious - just very bland. It would be fine for a business trip for a man but not exactly a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed out stay in this hotel- it has an excellent location near many good sites and lots of good tabernas. The room was very comfrotable and really exceeded my expectations. It was also very quiet which was my main concern for Madrid. We stayed in Sol Melia hotels throughout our time in Spain (of which this is part of) and were very happy with our experiences in them.

Reviews.Title: “Outrageous reception at the Tryp Ambassador”
Reviews.Author: girasol01
Reviews.Content: A very mixed experience. I greatly appreciated my first stay at the Tryp Ambassador in 2002. The staff at that time was attentive, the room was spacious and airy, the breakfast buffet was exceptional. It was such a comfortable experience that when I returned to Madrid in 2003 I again chose to stay at the Tryp Ambassador. This time the hotel lost my reservation and the manager was extremely rude in her reception of me. She was condescending, rude, and argued that I couldn't possibly have a reservation when in fact I had twice confirmed it weeks before. Only after I produced my copy of the reservation confirmation was I grudgingly provided with a small, dark room. I was entirely appalled at this reception and at the grossly inappropriate lack of courtesy. I visit Madrid often but would never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Baltimoron
Reviews.Content: Very beautiful and comfortable hotel in a great location near two metro stops. Got it bargain-priced on the internet, so it was a particularly good deal. The female reception staff at the hotel were exceptional. They helped with questions about directions, sending a package back to the US (and even giving us packing material to use), and setting up a massage for my girlfriend. Would think twice about getting the breakfast, which I believe cost 17€. It's a good breakfast but that's a lot of money for Spain! Anyway, I highly recommend the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location. The hotel's website had the best rates! Walking distance to Palacio Real, attractions, and several plazas. Spacious rooms! Very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: StJFamily
Reviews.Content: Stayed in October 2003. Excellent location within walking distance to many attractions, restaurants, and shopping. Our room was very quiet as it faced an interior courtyard though the room was a little stuffy and warm. Check the Sol Melia web site for good weekend rates.
